fullDescription.intro:
The G-Test is the proposed successor of the Chi-square-test as it handles small samples more robustly. It can test for the goodness of a fit to a distribution.
The Null Hypothesis H0 is that the compared columns are different.

tab.name: Options
tab.option: The column containing the observed frequency data under test.
The column containing the expeced data, e.g. the data a model predicted.
The column containing the other observed data under test.
H0 is rejected, if p-Value < α (0 < α < 1)

ports.inPort: The table containing expected and observed data.
